comment: Strong rye spice notes. Noticeable burn. Light caramel.
Tried Bourbon at Beer Culture as part of @GoodWhiskeyPassport
Most positive I had this at Moonlight mile
Had this at Wang Gang, very smooth.  Putting this in my top 5 Rotation. Enjoyed neat

This is a spivey and aggressive rye for 100 proof. On the nose you get the expected rye experience with sweet mint. The palate gets an initial burst of sugar that immediately turns hot with cinnamon and peppery notes dominating. I think this one and the operation as a whole shows a lot of promise. More age will defiantly help and I see a lot of good things to come from this brewstillery.
Woah. Didn't expect something so smooth and sweet. Could drink a tonnn of this.
Not a fan...too much bite not enough flavor

4.5/5

Minty, crisp, perfect rye taste with all the barrel, caramel taste from the aging.
aromatic.  sweet like caramel corn.  lots of rye flavor without the overpowering burn.
Notes of apricot, walnut, and pepper. Probably better with a single ice cube instead of neat, to bring out the flavor and ever so slightly mellow the 100 proof product.

If you wait long enough there’s a long dill finish, very much like I just stuck a dill branch in my mouth. Not necessarily a bad thing. I like dill. But, everything before that is rather unpleasant- mostly just ethanol burn.
Something weird is going on here but I don’t know what.
Delicious, oakey taste with minimal burn

Spicy, a bit sharp. 
———////——-
August 2017
Lex Airport
Great unique taste, will have to come back for more. Only got a taste in Columbus, Ohio 11/7/17
